In Kay, J. and Luckin, R. (Eds.) Rethinking Learning in the Digital Age: Making the Learning Sciences Count, 13th International Conference of the Learning Sciences (ICLS) 2018, Volume 3. London, UK: International Society of the Learning Sciences.

The learning sciences is concerned with studying how learners interact with each other in technologically-mediated environments, but core similarities and differences among tools are rarely addressed, limiting our ability to build a collective knowledge base. To address the issue, we present a revised version of Herringâ€™s (2007) scheme for classifying technological contexts of communication, updated for current technologies and their uses.
